verses.verse: It happened,<WH4438> when the kingdom of Rehoboam<WH7346> was established,<WH3559> and he was strong,<WH2393> that he forsook<WH5800> the law<WH8451> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and all Israel with him.<WH3478>

It happened in the fifth<WH2549> year<WH8141> of king<WH4428> Rehoboam,<WH7346> that Shishak<WH7895> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> came up<WH5927> against Jerusalem,<WH3389> because they had trespassed<WH4603> against Yahweh,<WH3068>

with twelve hundred<WH3967> chariots,<WH7393> and sixty<WH8346> thousand<WH505> horsemen.<WH6571> The people<WH5971> were without number<WH4557> who came<WH935> with him out of Egypt:<WH4714> the Lubim,<WH3864> the Sukkiim,<WH5525> and the Ethiopians.<WH3569>
He took<WH3920> the fortified<WH4694> cities<WH5892> which pertained to Judah,<WH3063> and came<WH935> to Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Now Shemaiah<WH8098> the prophet<WH5030> came<WH935> to Rehoboam,<WH7346> and to the princes<WH8269> of Judah,<WH3063> who were gathered together<WH622> to Jerusalem<WH3389> because<WH6440> of Shishak,<WH7895> and said<WH559> to them,<WH559> "Thus says Yahweh,<WH3068> <WH5800> 'You have forsaken me,<WH637> therefore have I also left<WH5800> you in the hand<WH3027> of Shishak.<WH7895>'"
Then the princes<WH8269> of Israel<WH3478> and the king<WH4428> humbled<WH3665> themselves;<WH559> and they said, "Yahweh<WH3068> is righteous.<WH6662>"

When Yahweh<WH3068> saw<WH7200> that they humbled<WH3665> themselves,<WH1697> the word of Yahweh<WH3068> came to Shemaiah,<WH8098> saying,<WH559> "They have humbled<WH3665> themselves.<WH7843> I will not destroy them;<WH5414> but I will grant them some<WH4592> deliverance,<WH6413> and my wrath<WH2534> shall not be poured out<WH5413> on Jerusalem<WH3389> by the hand<WH3027> of Shishak.<WH7895>
Nevertheless they shall be his servants,<WH5650> that they may know<WH3045> my service,<WH5656> and the service<WH5656> of the kingdoms<WH4467> of the countries.<WH776>"

So Shishak<WH7895> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> came up<WH5927> against Jerusalem,<WH3389> and took away<WH3947> the treasures<WH214> of the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and the treasures<WH214> of the king<WH4428>'s house.<WH1004> He took<WH3947> it all away.<WH3947> He also took away the shields<WH4043> of gold<WH2091> which Solomon<WH8010> had made.<WH6213>

King<WH4428> Rehoboam<WH7346> made<WH6213> in their place shields<WH4043> of brass,<WH5178> and committed<WH6485> them to the hands<WH3027> of the captains<WH8269> of the guard,<WH7323> who kept<WH8104> the door<WH6607> of the king<WH4428>'s house.<WH1004>

It was so,<WH1767> that as often as the king<WH4428> entered<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> the guard<WH7323> came<WH935> and bore<WH5375> them,<WH7725> and brought them back into the guard<WH7323> room.<WH8372>

When he humbled<WH3665> himself,<WH639> the wrath of Yahweh<WH3068> turned<WH7725> from him,<WH7843> so as not to destroy him altogether:<WH3617> and moreover in Judah<WH3063> there were good<WH2896> things found.<WH1697>

So king<WH4428> Rehoboam<WH7346> strengthened<WH2388> himself in Jerusalem,<WH3389> and reigned:<WH4427> for Rehoboam<WH7346> was forty<WH705> - one<WH259> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he began to reign,<WH4427> and he reigned<WH4427> seventeen<WH7651> years<WH8141> in Jerusalem,<WH3389> the city<WH5892> which Yahweh<WH3068> had chosen<WH977> out of all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel,<WH3478> to put<WH7760> his name<WH8034> there:<WH517> and his mother's name<WH8034> was Naamah<WH5279> the Ammonitess.<WH5985>
He did<WH6213> that which was evil,<WH7451> because he didn't<WH3559> set his heart<WH3820> to seek<WH1875> Yahweh.<WH3068>

Now the acts<WH1697> of Rehoboam,<WH7346> first<WH7223> and last,<WH314> aren't<WH3789> they written in the histories<WH1697> of Shemaiah<WH8098> the prophet<WH5030> and of Iddo<WH5714> the seer,<WH2374> after the way of genealogies?<WH3187> There were wars<WH4421> between Rehoboam<WH7346> and Jeroboam<WH3379> continually.<WH3117>
Rehoboam<WH7346> slept<WH7901> with his fathers,<WH1> and was buried<WH6912> in the city<WH5892> of David:<WH1732> and Abijah<WH29> his son<WH1121> reigned in his place.<WH4427>
